appendix:
附录 
a section of extra information added at the end of a book

阑尾 
a small tube at the beginning of the large intestine that can be removed by surgery if it 
becomes infected
apathy:
冷漠 
lack of feeling or emotion
chunk:
大块 
a thick piece of something
absolve:
免除；赦免 
to make (someone) free from guilt, responsibility, etc.
stack:
一堆 
a large amount of something

堆积 
to arrange (things) in a stack; to put (things) in a usually neat pile
indignant:
愤怒的 
feeling or showing anger because of something that is unfair or wrong; very angry
subtlety:
微妙，精妙，细微 
the quality or state of being subtle
dispassionate:
公平冷静的 
not influenced or affected by emotions
eminent:
杰出的 
successful, well-known and respected
dispel:
消除想法或感觉 
to make (something, such as a belief, feeling, or idea) go away or end

驱逐 
to drive away or cause to vanish by or as if by scattering
perch:
鸟 栖息；停留 
(of a bird) to land and stay on a branch, etc.

使 坐； 使 坐在 边沿 
to sit or to make somebody sit on something, especially on the edge of it

鸟的 栖息处，栖木 
a place where a bird rests, especially a branch or bar for this purpose, for example in a 
bird's cage

高座；高处 
a high seat or position 
96
broth:
汤；培养基 
liquid in which food (such as meat) has been cooked
prop:
支撑 
to support (something) by placing it against something else or by placing something under it
hypocritical:
伪善的 
a person who claims or pretends to have certain beliefs about what is right but who 
behaves in a way that disagrees with those beliefs
retaliation:
报复 
to do something bad to someone who has hurt you or treated you badly; to get revenge 
against someone
aftermath:
灾难性大事件的后果，余波 
the period of time after a bad and usually destructive event
determinant:
决定因素 
a thing that controls or influences what happens
speculate:
投机 
to invest money in ways that could produce a large profit but that also involve a lot of risk

推测 
to think about something and make guesses about it; to form ideas or theories about 
something usually when there are many things not known
conglomeration:
凝聚 
a process in which different things come together to form a single thing

混合物，聚集物 
a group or mixture of different things
mimic:
模仿，戏仿， 开玩笑地学 的样子 
to imitate (someone or their actions or words), especially in order to entertain or ridicule
efficacious:
有效的 
having the power to produce a desired result or effect
dismiss:
解雇 
to officially make (someone) leave a job; to end the employment or service of (someone)

不理会 
to decide not to think about or consider (something or someone)
prioritize:
优先考虑 
to organize (things) so that the most important thing is done or dealt with first 
97
revolt:
反叛，起义，叛乱 
to fight in a violent way against the rule of a leader or government
edifice:
大厦；宏伟建筑 
a large impressive building
tedium:
沉闷，单调乏味 
the quality or state of being tedious
belittle:
轻视，贬低 
to describe (someone or something) as little or unimportant
remorse:
懊悔；非常遗憾；自责 
the feeling of being extremely sorry for something wrong or bad that you have done
avert:
转移注意力，转移眼神 
to turn (your eyes, gaze, etc.) away or aside

防止，避免 
to prevent (something bad) from happening
pertain:
与 有关 
to relate to someone or something; to have a connection to a person or thing

适合 
to be appropriate to something
slumber:
睡眠 
the natural state of rest during which your eyes are closed and you become unconscious
mechanism:
机制，原理 
a process or system that is used to produce a particular result
avalanche:
雪崩 
a large amount of snow and ice or of dirt and rocks that slides suddenly down the side of a mountain
differentiate:
区分，辨别 
to see or state the difference or differences between two or more things
ensue:
随即发生 
to come at a later time; to happen as a result
innate:
固有的 
existing from the time a person or animal is born 
98
elicit:
得到信息，引起反应 
to get (a response, information, etc.) from someone
convulsion:
抽搐，痉挛 
a sudden violent shaking of the muscles in your body that you are unable to control

国家、体系、组织发生的动乱，骚乱 
a sudden change or disturbance that affects a country, organization, etc.
banish:
放逐，驱逐 
to force (someone) to leave a country as punishment
leverage:
杠杆作用 
the increase in force gained by using a lever

影响力 
influence or power used to achieve a desired result
throb:
身体部位有规律地抽动，抽痛 
(of a part of the body) to feel a series of regular painful movements

强烈有节奏地跳动，搏动，震响 
to beat or sound with a strong, regular rhythm 
99
encapsulate:
扼要概括 
to show or express the main idea or quality of (something) in a brief way

封装 
enclose (something) in or as if in a capsule
spiteful:
恶意的 
having or showing a desire to harm, anger, or defeat someone;having or showing spite
malicious:
恶意的 
having or showing a desire to cause harm to another person;having or showing malice
gravity:
重力；地球引力 
the force that attracts a body toward the center of the earth, or toward any other physical 
body having mass

事态的严重性，重大 
extreme importance and a cause for worry

言谈举止的庄重，严肃 
seriousness or solemnity of manner
proponent:
倡导者；支持者；拥护者 
a person who supports an idea or course of action
sane:
理性的，理智的 
based on reason or good judgment; rational or sensible
ion:
离子 
an atom or group of atoms that has a positive or negative electric charge from losing or 
gaining one or more electrons
sarcastic:
讽刺的 
using or showing sarcasm
perspiration:
流汗 
the act or process of perspiring

汗水 
the clear liquid that forms on your skin when you are hot or nervous; sweat 
100
euphemism:
委婉的说法，委婉语 
a mild or pleasant word or phrase that is used instead of one that is unpleasant or offensive
hideous:
非常令人不快的 
morally offensive; shocking

丑陋的，丑恶的 
very ugly or disgusting
dishearten:
使灰心，使沮丧 
to cause (a person or group of people) to lose hope, enthusiasm, or courage; to discourage (someone)
salvage:
抢救 
to save (something valuable or important); to prevent the loss of (something)
wobbly:
摆动的 
moving from side to side in an unsteady way

声音颤抖的 
(of a speaker, singer, or voice) having a tendency to move out of tone or slightly vary in pitch
motif:
作为装饰的图形，图式 
a design or a pattern used as a decoration

文学作品或音乐的主题，主旨，中心思想 
a subject, an idea or a phrase that is repeated and developed in a work of literature or a 
piece of music
malignant:
肿瘤或疾病恶性的 
dangerous to health; characterized by progressive and uncontrolled growth (especially of a tumor)

人 恶意的；恶毒的 
having or showing a strong desire to harm somebody
grotesque:
古怪的；怪诞的；荒唐的 
extremely different from what is expected or usual

丑陋的；奇形怪状的；极其难看的 
very strange or ugly in a way that is not normal or natural
agglomerate:
使 成团，聚结 
to form into a mass or group; to collect things and form them into a mass or group

大团；聚结物 
a mass or collection of things
encompass:
包含 
to include (something) as a part

包围 
to cover or surround (an area) 
101
solicitude:
挂念 
the quality of caring about other people's comfort, safety, and how they feel
embryonic:
胚胎的 
of or relating to an embryo

初期的，萌芽阶段的 
in an early or undeveloped stage
populous:
人口众多的 
having a large population
boastful:
自夸的 
talking too proudly about yourself
licentious:
放荡的，无道德的 
sexually immoral or offensive
insipid:
枯燥乏味的 
not interesting or exciting; dull or boring

没有味道的 
lacking strong flavor
infestation:
出没；侵扰；骚扰； 动、植物的寄生虫侵扰 
the presence of an unusually large number of insects or animals in a place, typically so as 
to cause damage or disease 大批
disembark:
着陆 
to leave a ship or airplane
anterior:
身体部位前部的；前面的 
(of a part of the body) at or near the front
siege:
围攻，军事包围 
a situation in which soldiers or police officers surround a city, building, etc., in order to try 
to take control of it
inauspicious:
不祥的，凶兆的 
not showing or suggesting that future success is likely; not auspicious
fanatic:
狂热的 
marked by excessive enthusiasm and often intense uncritical devotion 
102
premium:
额外费用 
a price that is higher than the regular price

高质量的 
of high or higher than normal quality
fragrant:
芳香的 
having a pleasant and usually sweet smell
stupor:
尤指由于醉酒、吸毒或震动而出现的神志不清，恍惚，麻痹状态 
a state in which you are unable to think, hear, etc. clearly, especially because you have 
drunk too much alcohol, taken drugs or had a shock
evasive:
逃避的 
done to avoid harm, an accident, etc.
fare:
进展；成功 
to do something well or badly
